definition: to nibble away at sth/to eat into/to erode

sentences.english: This eclipse will be difficult for a number of reasons.
sentences.chinese: 因爲幾個原因，這個月蝕將變得有些困難。

sentences.english: There are many ways this eclipse may affect you, and one is travel.
sentences.chinese: 這次月蝕有很多種方法去影響你，其中一個就是旅行。

sentences.english: The gates of mercy, like an eclipse, darken our undersides .
sentences.chinese: 仁慈的門戶，猶如月蝕，陰暗了我們的下腹。

sentences.english: This won't be an easy eclipse, but you are flexible and resourceful.
sentences.chinese: 這不會是一樣容易的月蝕，但你是靈活和足智多謀的。

sentences.english: In a lunar eclipse, Earth passes between the sun and the moon.
sentences.chinese: 在一次月蝕中，地球將從太陽和月球之間經過。

sentences.english: The week before and after the lunar eclipse is a time to postpone important decisions.
sentences.chinese: 在月蝕的前一週和後一週是延緩重要決定的時間。

sentences.english: Next month, on August 5, we will have a lunar (full moon) eclipse in Aquarius.
sentences.chinese: 下個月8月5日，我們會迎來一次水瓶座月蝕。

definition: lit. flowers in a mirror and the moon reflected in the lake (idiom)/fig. an unrealistic rosy view/viewing things through rose-tinted spectacles/also written 水月鏡花|水月镜花
literary (rather than colloquial) pronunciation of a Chinese character
Horse-Face, one of the two guardians of the underworld in Chinese mythology
lit. dragon soaring and tiger leaping (idiom)/fig. prosperous and bustling/vigorous and active
variant of 閻羅|阎罗[Yan2 luo2]/Yama, King of Hell/translation of Sanskrit: Yama Raja
to dress up and make up (like an actor)
